text: David is looking for somewhere to put his croquet club.
What do you mean by that?
Well he's got a croquet club without a ground.
A number of people not a club stick?
It's not called like a golf club that you hit the ball with?
(()) Not looking much of a hurry
What's that thing out there hydrants or something?
He  (()) occasionally he gets by the club.
Yes he was he is the Secretary of Eden Park Croquet Club which was an offshoot of Eden Park Cricket Club.
They don't have anywhere to play?
at the moment they don't have anywhere to play.
What do you need for a croquet club?
Well you need ideally some space for about four or five tennis courts to run
Well that would run you three lawns
As big as a tennis court?
I believe it's twenty four by sixteen ideally.
Is that bigger than a tennis court?
It's about the size of a double tennis court apparently.
(()) Presumably you can't use it for anything else because it needs to be very smooth and perfect.
Is there cold air blowing in this car?
I know  (()) any air but something's blowing.
You can erm  you can't use it for anything else but croquet?
But then it's not a very big area.
You know as you can't use a tennis court for anything else or bowling green for anything else.
But it does sound quite a big area to me if you haven't got the land in the first place.
It would mean somebody's got to give up something.
You could fit it on a bowling green.
But then who wants to give up a bowling green?
That's fine but you haven't got any land at all.
It's quite a lot of land to find.
It's not like somebody's back garden.
So where were they playing today?
Is there a croquet club there?
Which is where Carlos used to live.
How many croquet clubs are there around here?

Apparently the Mayor last year or the Mayoress er was rather keen and organized a match between the Dulwich Club and her team nominally which turned out to be made up of masters from Dulwich College <laugh> .
Well apparently they have a lawn and they play it.
Oh you need people who know the game anyway.
You need to know how to play.
Well I was reading that article in the Sunday Times with you and the chap who's the champion said he liked it because it's like chess and bridge.
Or I mean David was saying you can do this you can do that you can do the other you can do this.
I I my mind was absolutely blown by the end.
It it was almost impossible to erm
If somebody was used to teaching croquet they wouldn't tell you everything all at once.
And you can gradually build up.
Well he was coaching me and he was very good.
I can understand why he has been invited to coach.
